name: ms-teams-vscode-extension
description: Create, debug, and deploy Teams apps with Teams Toolkit
author: Microsoft Corporation

teamsfx-add-feature.description: Add feature icon in command tree view

teamsfx-developer-portal.description: Developer portal icon in command tree view

teamsfx-m365.description: Microsoft 365 icon in command tree view

teamsfx-add-environment.description: Microsoft 365 icon in command tree view

viewsWelcome.contents:
To start Teams app development experience, create a project or explore our samples. For more information, visit [Get Started](command:fx-extension.openWelcome?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D), [How-to guides](command:fx-extension.selectTutorials?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D) or [Documentation](command:fx-extension.openDocument?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D).
[Create a new Teams app](command:fx-extension.create?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
[View samples](command:fx-extension.openSamples?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
You can also open an existing Teams app.
[Open folder](command:vscode.openFolder)

To start Teams app development experience, create a project or explore our samples. For more information, visit [Get Started](command:fx-extension.openWelcome?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D), [How-to guides](command:fx-extension.selectTutorials?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D) or [Documentation](command:fx-extension.openDocument?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D).
[Create a new Teams app](command:fx-extension.create?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
[View samples](command:fx-extension.openSamples?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
You can also open an existing Teams app.
[Open folder](command:vscode.openFolder)
You need to upgrade the project to the new configuration files to use the latest features. The upgrade process will not change your custom code and create the backup files in case revert is needed.
Notice this upgrade is a must-have to continue to use current version Teams Toolkit. If you are not ready to upgrade and want to continue to use the old version Teams Toolkit, please find Teams Toolkit in Extension and install the version <=2.10.0.
[Upgrade project](command:fx-extension.checkProjectUpgrade)

Jump right into Teams Toolkit and get an overview of the fundamentals.
[Get Started](command:fx-extension.openWelcome?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
Create a project or explore our samples.
[Create a new Teams app](command:fx-extension.create?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
[View samples](command:fx-extension.openSamples?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
Walk through the steps to build a real-world Teams app.
[Documentation](command:fx-extension.openDocument?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)
[How-to guides](command:fx-extension.selectTutorials?%5B%22SideBar%22%5D)

editor/title.when: resourceFilename == manifest.local.template.json || resourceFilename == manifest.remote.template.json || resourceFilename == manifest.template.json && !fx-extension.isV3Enabled

background.endsPattern: ^.*(Worker process started and initialized|Host lock lease acquired by instance ID).*$

problemMatchers.name: teamsfx-func-hosted-bot-watch
problemMatchers.label: TeamsFx Azure Functions Hosted Bot Problems

background.endsPattern: ^.*(Worker process started and initialized|Host lock lease acquired by instance ID).*$
Local tunnel service is started successfully

funcCoreTools.description: Ensure Azure Functions Core Tools is installed.

ngrok.description: Ensure Ngrok is installed and started.

yo.description: Ensure Yeoman CLI is installed. (Requires reload of VS Code)

sharepointYeomanGenerator.description: Ensure SPFx Yeoman Generator is installed. (Requires reload of VS Code)

walkthroughs.title: Get started with Teams Toolkit
walkthroughs.description: Jumpstart your Teams app development experience

steps.title: Get your environment ready
steps.description:
Teams Toolkit primarily requires NPM and Node.js. Check your environment and get ready for your first Teams app development.
[Run prerequisite checker](command:fx-extension.validate-getStarted-prerequisites?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)

steps.title: Build your first Teams app
steps.description:
Choose [Teams app capabilities](https://aka.ms/teamsfx-capabilities-overview) and build your first Teams app.
You can create it from the scratch or explore our samples to help you quickly get started with the real-world examples and code structures.
[Create a new Teams app](command:fx-extension.createFromWalkthrough?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)
[View samples](command:fx-extension.openSamples?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)

steps.title: Create a Microsoft 365 testing tenant for free
steps.description:
Create a free Microsoft 365 testing tenant to install and preview your Teams apps in Teams.
 If you already have a Microsoft 365 organizational account, [sign in to Microsoft 365](command:fx-extension.signinM365?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D) and validate [sideloading](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/concepts/build-and-test/prepare-your-o365-tenant#enable-custom-teams-apps-and-turn-on-custom-app-uploading) is enabled.
[Create a Microsoft 365 testing tenant](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/dev-program)

steps.title: Preview your Teams app locally
steps.description:
Press [F5](command:fx-extension.selectAndDebug?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D) or discover '[Run and Debug](command:workbench.view.debug)' panel on the activity bar, and click the play icon to locally preview your app in Teams context.
[Run local preview (F5)](command:fx-extension.selectAndDebug?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)
__Tip: To run local preview, sign in to Microsoft 365 (organizational account) with sideloading option.__

steps.title: Deploy Teams apps
steps.description:
You can provision resources in the cloud and deploy your app's code to the provisioned resources. Finally, distribute your first app to Teams.
[Open Deployment commands](command:fx-extension.openDeploymentTreeview?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)
__Tip: Learn more about ['Deployment'](https://aka.ms/teamsfx-provision).__

steps.title: What's next?
steps.description:
Here are some recommendations to continue your journey with Teams Toolkit.
 • Explore [Tutorials](command:fx-extension.selectTutorials?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D) and get more practical guidances
 • Open [Readme.md](command:fx-extension.openReadMe?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D) to understand how to develop this app
 • Read our [Documentation](command:fx-extension.openDocument?%5B%22WalkThrough%22%5D)

scripts.compile: tsc -p ./ && npm run copy-files && npm run copy-whatisnew-files
scripts.build: rimraf out && webpack --mode development --config ./webpack.config.js && npm run compile
scripts.pretest: npm run lint && npm run check-format && npm run test-compile
scripts.test:unit: rimraf out && rimraf coverage && npm run compile && nyc mocha --config .mocharc.json
